DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate impact Burch colposuspension ( BC ) , anti-incontinence measure , patient urinary incontinence ( UI ) undergo abdominal surgery pelvic organ prolapse ( POP ) repair
DOC.brief_title: Pelvic Organ Prolapse Repair With Without Concomitant Burch Colposuspension Patients With Urinary Incontinence
DOC.detailed_description: Forty-seven woman suffer POP UI randomly assign abdominal POP repair concomitant BC ( 24 patient ; group A ) POP repair alone without anti-incontinence procedure ( 23 patient . ; group B ) . They followed-up 3 , 6 , 9 month surgery annually . The primary outcome measure anatomical outcome change incontinence status indicate bladder diary , number daily pad stress test . Secondary endpoint change subjective symptom Quality Life ( QoL ) measure Urogenital Distress Inventory ( UDI-6 ) Impact Incontinence Quality Life ( IIQ-7 ) questionnaires .
DOC.criteria: Study inclusion criterion POP > 2 , UI define ICS [ 2 ] , age ≥ 18 ≤ 75 yr . Benign malignant uterus lesion ( leiomyoma , fibromyoma , cervical endometrial carcinoma ) Active pelvic inflammatory disease , Known hypersensitivity synthetic material ( polypropylene , polythetrafloroethilene , polyethileneterephtalate , polyglactil acid polyglycolic acid ) Pregnancy lactation Evidence clinically significant cardiovascular , renal , hepatic respiratory disease ; Any condition judgment investigator would interfere subject 's ability provide inform consent , comply study instruction , place subject increase risk , might confound interpretation study result .
DOC.keyword: Pelvic organ prolapse , Urinary incontinence , Burch colposuspension , surgery
